summary: Concerns about financial accounting of federal assistance Under the Compacts of Free Association, U.S. agencies can provide assistance to the Federated States of Micronesia and the Republic of the Marshall Islands in the form of grants, services, technical assistance, and loans. To ensure that U.S. assistance is properly administered, the U.S. agencies look at findings from audits of each nation's financial statements ("single audits").This supplement...
title: Single Audit Analysis: Federated States of Micronesia and the Republic of the Marshall Islands (GAO-16-760SP), an E-Supplement to GAO-16-550T
